data.text:
Come Work With Us!

Austin Film Festival is a place full of high-functioning, creative people dedicated to inspiring and championing the work of screenwriters, filmmakers, and all artists who use the language of film and television to tell a story. We’re looking for autonomous, hardworking people to help shape one of the most inspiring screenwriters’ conference and film festivals around. If you’re a goal-oriented, creative problem solver we would love for you to get in touch. By joining the Austin Film Festival family you’ll enter an environment with a strong sense of camaraderie and hard work.

We hire for multiple positions throughout the year! Check back with us regularly to see updated listings. Don’t forget to check out our opportunities to intern or volunteer with AFF all year round.

WHO WE ARE: Austin Film Festival furthers the art and craft of filmmaking by inspiring and championing the work of screenwriters, filmmakers, and all artists who use the language of film, television, theatre, and new media to tell a story. AFF is dedicated to providing unique cultural events and services, enhancing public awareness and participation and encouraging long lasting community partnerships. The Austin Film Festival is a not for profit 501c3 corporation.

ALL APPLICATIONS REQUIRE:

· Resume

· Completed application

· Cover letter

· Minimum of three professional references

Venue Logistics Coordinator

Austin Film Festival is looking for a natural-born organizer who thrives on the structure and efficiency of planning, organizing, and getting things done as our Venue Logistics Coordinator. Local applicants only, please. No remote opportunities available.

POSITION: Venue Logistics Coordinator

HIRE DATES: August 8 – November 15

WORK HOURS: Temporary. 40 hrs/ week. Monday thru Friday, will require additional hours on weekends and in the weeks leading up to and during the Festival. In-Person. No remote opportunities available. Local applicants are preferred.

REPORTS TO: Executive Director

COMPENSATION: $844/ week

ABOUT US: Austin Film Festival (AFF) furthers the art and craft of filmmaking by inspiring and championing the work of screenwriters, filmmakers, and all artists who use the language of film, television, theatre, and new media to tell a story. AFF is dedicated to providing unique cultural events and services, enhancing public awareness and participation and encouraging long lasting community partnerships. The Austin Film Festival is a not-for-profit 501c3 corporation.

JOB DESCRIPTION: The Venue Logistics Coordinator is responsible for organizing and following through with all logistical needs regarding signage and other related rentals at all venues as well as manage a team of volunteers to set up and break down across all Festival and Conference locations.

ENVIRONMENT: While working for this critically recognized organization, applicants are expected to be able to work efficiently and professionally in a fast-paced, team-oriented production environment. In such an environment, the ability to work well under pressure, excellent communication skills and intense organizational skills are a must.

RESONSIBILITIES: The responsibilities of the Venue Logistics Coordinator include but are not limited to:

Pre-Festival

Serve as AFF’s point-of-contact for office space rental (aka AFF’s Tech Center), out of which all Festival & Conference operations will occur during the week of October 23

Manager and supervise the move-in and maintenance of the Tech Center, including phone and internet set up

Work closely with AFF departments to plan venue needs

Work with the Executive Dept. to fulfill City of Austin permit requirements

Manage AFF equipment storage unit(s), including moving and transporting

Serve as point person for equipment and rental vendors

Acquire the necessary equipment and rental items for Festival use, such as:

banners, signs, easels, director’s chairs, pipe and drape, walkies

Coordinate with venue contacts and AFF’s audio-visual contractor for proper timing of set up and breakdown of equipment

Serving as point person for any signage that needs to be created

Manage and adhere to a set, pre-determined budget

Secure and manage a robust team of 10-15 volunteers to help prep and execute day to day load-in and outs, set up, and breakdown during the Festival

During the Festival:

Oversee overall setup of all venues throughout the extent of the Festival, including possible changes in programming/venues on short notice, insuring the facilitation of a successful Festival

Assist Conference Dept. to ensure conference venues are set up according to pre-determined schedule

Coordinate all Conference water supply needs

Assist Sponsorship Dept. to ensure sponsorship venues are set up according to a pre-determined schedule, including sponsorship banners are displayed properly

Assist Film Dept. to ensure film venues are set up according to a pre-determined schedule

Assist Marketing Dept. to ensure red carpet events are set up according to a pre-determined schedule

Coordinate with venues and preferred audio-visual contractor for proper timing of set up and breakdown of equipment

Managing and delivery of the proper number of director’s chairs for panels and Q&A’s at various Festival locations

Provide AFF departments with updates on venue set ups

Adhering to all signage needs for Austin Film Festival TV Show, On Story®

Manage check-in / check-out of walkies during the Festival

Manage programming/signing in/signing out AFF phones, mainly used by Transportation and Volunteer depts.

Post-Festival:

Manage return of equipment and rentals to vendors

Manage return of AFF equipment to storage unit(s) in an orderly manner for future use

Manage and supervise move-out of the Tech Center

Provide wrap up and update materials, including inventory and invoicing

In General:

Providing exemplary customer service

Provide weekly reports and attend weekly meetings

Adhere to and complete a pre-determined timeline

Create wrap up report and provide completion materials

Commitment to the AFF Mission Statement

QUALIFICATIONS:

Must be able to lift at least 25 lbs.

Excellent time management, problem solving skills, and patience

Experience working with, communicating with and managing a team

Excellent interpersonal skills and an ability to exercise patience

Customer service experience

Ability to prioritize/delegate in high stress, high volume situations and deal with last-minute changes

Prior attendance to Austin Film Festival is a plus

Must have a car, valid driver’s license, auto insurance policy, and be comfortable operating a van/box truck

Microsoft Office skills required

Must be available during the Austin Film Festival, October 24 – 31, 2024

HOW TO APPLY:

Complete application via http://bit.ly/affjobs

Submit a cover letter

Submit a current résumé

Provide at least three references

Theater Operations Manager

POSITION: Theater Operations Manager

CONTRACTED TIME PERIOD: September 2 – November 15

WORK HOURS: Temporary. 40 hrs/ week. Monday thru Friday, will require additional hours and weekends in the weeks leading up to and during the Festival and Conference. In-Person, no remote opportunity. Local applicants are preferred.

REPORTS TO: Executive Director and Film Administrator

COMPENSTATION: $6,500 for Contracted Time Period

ABOUT US: Austin Film Festival (AFF) furthers the art and craft of filmmaking by inspiring and championing the work of screenwriters, filmmakers, and all artists who use the language of film, television, theatre, and new media to tell a story. AFF is dedicated to providing unique cultural events and services, enhancing public awareness and participation and encouraging long lasting community partnerships. The Austin Film Festival is a not-for-profit 501c3 corporation.

JOB DESCRIPTION: The Theater Operations Manager hires, trains and coordinates all film production volunteers and manages theater Front of House operations during the festival.

ENVIRONMENT: While working for this critically recognized organization, applicants are expected to be able to work efficiently and professionally in a fast-paced, team-oriented production environment. In such an environment, the ability to work well under pressure, excellent communication skills and intense organizational skills are a must.

RESPONSIBILITIES: The responsibilities of the Theater Operations Manager include but are not limited to:

Pre-Festival:

Recruit and hire all Front of House staff and volunteers, including theater managers, filmmaker liaisons, interns and volunteers

Coordinate Front of House team, including scheduling and training on AFF’s policies and procedures

Prepare all Front of House materials, including venue boxes, binders, introduction scripts and queue cards

Work with Accounting department to train theater managers on taking payments at venues

Attend all venue walk-thrus; know venue size and expected attendance in order to determine number of volunteer and staff members needed

During the Festival:

Update Theater Manager schedules, fill positions as needed

Maintain Front of House materials, as needed, including venue boxes, binders, introduction scripts and queue cards

Assist Production Manager in performing tech checks with filmmakers during the Festival as needed

Provide daily attendance reports during the Festival to Film and Executive departments

Post-Festival:

Provide wrap up of Front of House materials

Provide completion materials, including but not limited to wrap up report, archiving of documents and resources, and updating Theater Operations training materials

Ongoing:

Attend all Film Department and Staff meetings

Provide weekly reports to Executive Director, Managing Director and Film Department

Adhere to and complete a predetermined timeline

Provide exemplary customer service

Commitment to the AFF Mission Statement

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s Degree preferred

Must have extensive knowledge of the Festival & Writers Conference

A self-motivated, self-starter adept at juggling multiple projects and problem solving

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Attention to detail and good follow-through

Extensive customer service experience

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Ability to prioritize and delegate in high stress, high volume situations; works well under pressure

Must have a car

Microsoft Office skills required

Must be available during the Austin Film Festival which takes place October 24 – October 31, 2024

HOW TO APPLY:

Complete application via http://bit.ly/affjobs

Submit a cover letter

Submit a current résumé

Provide at least three references

Volunteer Manager

Austin Film Festival is seeking applicants for the Volunteer Manager position which is full-time starting on July 17. Regional applicants required, in-person only, no remote opportunities available.

POSITION: Volunteer Manager

HIRE DATES: July 17 – November 17

WORK HOURS: Temporary. 40 hrs/ week. Monday thru Friday, will require additional hours and weekends in the weeks leading up to and during the Festival and Conference. In-Person, no remote opportunity. Local applicants are preferred.

REPORTS TO: Executive Director

COMPENSTATION: $625/ Week

ABOUT US: Austin Film Festival (AFF) furthers the art and craft of filmmaking by inspiring and championing the work of screenwriters, filmmakers, and all artists who use the language of film, television, theatre, and new media to tell a story. AFF is dedicated to providing unique cultural events and services, enhancing public awareness and participation and encouraging long lasting community partnerships. The Austin Film Festival is a not-for-profit 501c3 corporation.

JOB DESCRIPTION: Volunteer Manager will be responsible for recruiting, managing, motivating, engaging, and scheduling a large group of volunteers to support the staff and organization leading up to and during the Festival.

ENVIRONMENT: While working for this critically recognized organization, applicants are expected to be able to work efficiently and professionally in a fast-paced, team-oriented production environment. In such an environment, the ability to work well under pressure, excellent communication skills and intense organizational skills are a must.

RESPONSIBILITIES: The responsibilities of the Volunteer Manager include but are not limited to:

Volunteer Recruitment

Oversee volunteer recruiting needs

Organize and manage a ‘Call for Volunteers’ campaign, brainstorming and executing marketing initiatives, and collaborating with other organizations to recruit volunteers

Work with volunteers to create the best possible volunteer experience

Organize and lead volunteer orientations

Oversee volunteer schedules, ensure volunteers show up for their shifts, avoid gaps in department needs

Review and approve total volunteer hours for earned rewards

Plan a post-Festival Volunteer Appreciation event

Management

Manage the Volunteer Coordinator

Work with departments to assess volunteer needs, build volunteer shift schedules

Learn and maintain the volunteer database

Assign volunteer schedules, solve problems by quickly relocating or recruiting new volunteers when openings arise due to volunteer issues

General

People-oriented, able to communicate clearly, professionally, and consistently with staff and a large volunteer base

Provide exemplary customer service

Provide weekly reports and attend weekly meetings

Adhere to and complete a pre-determined timeline

Create wrap up report and provide completion materials, including but not limited to updating of training materials

Commitment to the AFF Mission Statement

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field

Experience managing and effectively communicating to large groups of people

Excellent oral and written communication skills, as well as interpersonal skills

Extensive customer service experience

Ability to work in databases and keep accurate records

Ability to prioritize and delegate in high stress situations

High common sense and good discretion; trustworthy and responsible communicator

Outstanding organizational skills and attention to detail

Must be able to handle high stress situations and multi-task

Excellent time management, problem solving skills, and patience

Must have a car

Microsoft Office skills required

Must be available during the Austin Film Festival, October 24 – October 31, 2024

HOW TO APPLY:

Complete application via http://bit.ly/affjobs

Submit a cover letter

Submit a current résumé

Provide at least three references

Film Marketing Coordinator

POSITION: Film Marketing Coordinator

HIRE DATES: September 9 – November 8

WORK HOURS: Hours variable of full-time hours, plus, during contracted period. Temporary. Monday thru Friday, will require additional hours and weekends in the weeks leading up to and during the Festival and Conference. In-Person, no remote opportunity. Local applicants are preferred.

REPORTS TO: Marketing and Film Departments

COMPENSTATION: $6,500 total

ABOUT US: Austin Film Festival (AFF) furthers the art and craft of filmmaking by inspiring and championing the work of screenwriters, filmmakers, and all artists who use the language of film, television, theatre, and new media to tell a story. AFF is dedicated to providing unique cultural events and services, enhancing public awareness and participation and encouraging long lasting community partnerships. The Austin Film Festival is a not-for-profit 501c3 corporation.

JOB DESCRIPTION: The Film Marketing Coordinator works with the Marketing and Film Departments to create an effective marketing plan for every film accepted into the Festival. The Film Marketing Coordinator facilitates and organizes partnership strategies and communicates this information to both the filmmakers and staff. In addition, the Film Marketing Coordinator creates and distributes marketing materials leading up to and during the festival.

ENVIRONMENT: While working for this critically recognized organization, applicants are expected to be able to work efficiently and professionally in a fast-paced, team-oriented production environment. In such an environment, the ability to work well under pressure, excellent communication skills and intense organizational skills are a must.

RESPONSIBILITIES: The responsibilities of the Film Marketing Coordinator include but are not limited to:

Learn overall AFF marketing practices, current relationships, and strategies used in previous years, as well as all feature films for this year’s Festival

Work with Marketing and Film Departments to create an effective marketing plan for each film on behalf of the Festival

Work closely with Development Department to provide filmmaker information for ad sales and local partnerships.

Work with participating Filmmakers to encourage and collect marketing materials (posters, postcards, etc.) and advise them on their individual marketing plans

Facilitate PR/Marketing Conference Calls with all participating Filmmakers

Facilitate partnerships and attendance within the community

Promote sales of filmmaker tickets and advanced group tickets

Create leads and promote discounted group film passes to businesses, organizations, and other groups.

Create flyers, dailies, and other marketing materials

Provide social media content to Marketing team, including Short Film announcements

Manage AFF Sched site during the Festival

Manage a team of student interns and volunteers

Create Weekly Status Reports for the Marketing and Film Departments

Adhere to and complete a predetermined timeline

Provide exemplary customer service

Provide wrap up and completion materials including totals for individual and bulk ticket sales

Tracks and reports on films performance on Sched (online schedule)

Provide exemplary customer service

Provide completion materials, including but not limited to wrap up report, archiving of documents and resources, and updating Film Marketing Coordinator training materials

Commitment to the AFF Mission Statement

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s Degree preferred

Must have extensive knowledge of the Festival

A self-motivated, self-starter adept at juggling multiple projects and problem solving

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Attention to detail and good follow-through

Extensive customer service experience

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Ability to prioritize and delegate in high stress, high volume situations; works well under pressure

Must be available during the Austin Film Festival which takes place October 24 – 31, 2024

Submit a cover letter
